dialogue.htmlContent:
[style.boldArcane(Kay's Textiles)]
Tucked away in one corner of the district, there's a modestly-sized, wooden warehouse with the words 'Kay's Textiles' painted in large pink lettering across the frontage. Nailed into the wall beside the front entrance, there's a sign which declares this warehouse to be open from #IF(game.isExtendedWorkTime()) [style.colourMinorGood([unit.time(6)]-[unit.time(22)])]. As such, it's currently [style.colourGood(open)], so you'd be able to head inside if you wanted to. #ELSE [style.colourMinorBad([unit.time(6)]-[unit.time(22)])]. As such, it's currently [style.colourBad(closed)], so you'll have to come back during opening hours if you wanted to head inside. #ENDIF

#IF(game.isExtendedWorkTime())

#IF(pc.getQuest(QUEST_LINE_RELATIONSHIP_NYAN_HELP)==QUEST_RELATIONSHIP_NYAN_3_STOCK_ISSUES_DOBERMANNS) Although you've managed to discover that Wolfgang and Karl have seized control of Kay's business, you've yet to resolve the situation. Sooner or later, you're going to have to confront the two dobermanns again and convince them to leave Kay alone... #ELSEIF(pc.isQuestProgressGreaterThan(QUEST_LINE_RELATIONSHIP_NYAN_HELP, QUEST_RELATIONSHIP_NYAN_3_STOCK_ISSUES_DOBERMANNS)) Having rescued [kay.namePos] business from Wolfgang and Karl, you've been given permission to come and go from the premises as you please. What's more, the thankful [kay.race] said that you could pay [kay.herHim] a personal visit whenever you feel like it... #ELSE Having told Nyan that you'd discover why Kay has suddenly stopped doing business with her, you're going to have to head inside the warehouse and find out what's going on... #ENDIF

#ENDIF

#IF(game.getDialogueFlags().hasFlag(FLAG_supplierDepotDoorUnlocked))

Pushing open the front door, you [pc.step] inside the warehouse and once again take stock of your surroundings. Just like the last time you were here, the series of arcane-powered lights secured to the high ceiling are casting the entire interior in a bright, slightly off-white light, which, combined with the steady mechanical hum that's coming from within the building, gives this place a very industrial feel.

Although the reception area in which you're currently standing is within a small annex, there's no wall to partition it from the rest of the warehouse. Looking straight ahead, you're able to see through to the cavernous interior, the vast majority of which has been converted into a busy factory floor. From where you're standing, the source of the background humming noise can easily be seen to be the dozens of arcane weaving machines, each one of which is being operated by a textile worker.

Over to your left, there's a small waiting area consisting of a few sofas arranged around a glass coffee table, while to your right, the same smartly-dressed rabbit-girl who was here the last time you visited is sitting behind her wooden desk. #IF(pc.isQuestProgressGreaterThan(QUEST_LINE_RELATIONSHIP_NYAN_HELP, QUEST_RELATIONSHIP_NYAN_3_STOCK_ISSUES_DOBERMANNS)) As she catches sight of you, this receptionist flashes you a happy smile and waves you on, signalling that you're free to come and go from here whenever you please. #ELSE As she catches sight of you, this receptionist lets out a sorrowful sigh and waves you on, signalling that she really doesn't care how many times you come and go from here. #ENDIF

#ELSE

Pushing open the front door, you [pc.step] inside the warehouse and take stock of your surroundings. A series of arcane-powered lights secured to the high ceiling are casting the entire interior in a bright, slightly off-white light, which, combined with the steady mechanical hum that's coming from within the building, gives this place a very industrial feel.

Although the reception area in which you're currently standing is within a small annex, there's no wall to partition it from the rest of the warehouse. Looking straight ahead, you're able to see through to the cavernous interior, the vast majority of which looks to have been converted into a busy factory floor. From where you're standing, the source of the background humming noise can be seen to be dozens of what appear to be curious types of weaving machine, each one of which is being operated by a textile worker.

Over to your left, there's a small waiting area consisting of a few sofas arranged around a glass coffee table, while to your right, a smartly-dressed rabbit-girl is performing the duty of receptionist, and is slouched down behind a wooden desk. As she catches sight of you, this receptionist lets out a sorrowful sigh and drums her padded fingers on her desk. In order to gain access to the warehouse, it looks like you're going to have to deal with this upset rabbit-girl...

#ENDIF

[pc.Walking] over to stand before the receptionist's desk, you tell her that you're here regarding the halted shipments of enchanted goods to Nyan's Clothing Emporium, and that you'd like to see Kay himself as soon as possible. After looking you up and down, she lets out yet another weary sigh and slowly replies in a depressed tone, [style.speechFeminine(Sure, you can try to see Mr. Kay if you want to... Just go on ahead...)]

Motioning for you to continue on into the warehouse, the receptionist slouches down in her chair and casts her eyes downwards. Having secured an appointment with Kay, which you now know to be his surname, you prepare to set off into the building, but before you go, the receptionist seems to have a sudden change in attitude, and calls out, [style.speechFeminine(Hey, wait a sec! You look like you can take care of yourself, but I guess I should warn you anyway... There's a couple of dobermann bounty hunters up there who've effectively taken complete control of this place. They're not letting anyone see Mr. Kay, but maybe you can do something to get rid of them. If things continue like they are now, this place is going to go bust before long...)]

Having received this warning, and now with a clue of what could have happened to Kay, you [pc.step] away from the receptionist's desk and prepare to head into the warehouse...

#IF(pc.isQuestProgressGreaterThan(QUEST_LINE_RELATIONSHIP_NYAN_HELP, QUEST_RELATIONSHIP_NYAN_3_STOCK_ISSUES_DOBERMANNS))

The reception area of Kay's Textiles consists of a small waiting area and a wooden desk, behind which the familiar, smartly-dressed rabbit-girl is currently sitting. With the expulsion of Wolfgang and Karl, the receptionist's attitude has completely changed, and without the slightest hint of boredom on her face, she flashes you a happy smile and gives you a little wave.

Having been granted complete freedom to come and go from this warehouse as you please, you wonder whether you should head back out into Dominion, or instead turn around and go back into the warehouse.

#ELSE

The reception area of Kay's Textiles consists of a small waiting area and a wooden desk, behind which the familiar, smartly-dressed rabbit-girl is currently sitting. Looking over at you, she lets out a weary sigh, before resting her head on her desk and closing her eyes.

Having been granted freedom to come and go from this warehouse as you please, you wonder whether you should head back out into Dominion, or instead turn around and go back into the warehouse.

#ENDIF

Running along the near-side wall of the warehouse, there's nothing to separate this corridor from the rest of the building's large interior, allowing you to observe the dozens of textile workers as they operate their arcane weaving machines. At one end of the corridor, next to the entrance and reception, there's a storage area stacked full of wooden boxes, while on the opposite end, a staircase leads up to a small mezzanine floor. A modestly-sized room has been built upon this raised platform, and above its mirrored-glass windows, the words 'Overseer's Station & Kay's Office' have been painted in large, white letters.

At the end of the corridor closest to the warehouse's entrance, a large, open-sided annex has been constructed to serve as a storage area. Numerous metal shelving units, stacked full of countless wooden crates, are arranged in rows throughout the expansive area. The vast majority of these crates are labelled as containing either raw materials for the arcane weaving machines or fulfilled orders for export all around Lilith's Realm.

#IF(pc.isQuestProgressGreaterThan(QUEST_LINE_RELATIONSHIP_NYAN_HELP, QUEST_RELATIONSHIP_NYAN_3_STOCK_ISSUES_DOBERMANNS))

A weathered, open-topped crate positioned near to the front of this storage area is noticeably larger than all the others, and has the words 'Surplus Disposal' painted in large black letters across its side. #IF(game.getDialogueFlags().hasFlag(FLAG_kayCratesSearched)) With [kay.namePos] permission, [style.colourMinorBad(you've already taken today's clothing surplus)], and so there's nothing else for you to do except [pc.step] away from the crate and prepare to head elsewhere... #ELSE Having been given permission by [kay.name], you could always take a look inside the crate and [style.colourMinorGood(help yourself to the items of clothing)] which would otherwise be discarded... #ENDIF

#ELSE

A weathered, open-topped crate positioned near to the front of this storage area is noticeably larger than all the others, and has the words 'Surplus Disposal' painted in large black letters across its side. Although there are several items of what appear to be discarded clothing inside, the crate is within direct line-of-sight from the overseer's station at the far end of the corridor. Although it seems a waste to have to abandon those items of perfectly-serviceable clothing to their fate, you don't want to be seen rescuing them and accused of stealing, so you [pc.step] away from the crate and prepare to head elsewhere...

#ENDIF

Having now taken everything of value from the 'Surplus Disposal' crate, there's nothing more for you to do except turn around and leave. There's sure to be new items to take tomorrow, but until then, there's no point in returning to this area...

[pc.Stepping] up to the 'Surplus Disposal' crate, you take a look inside and see if you can find anything worth taking. Although most of the crate's contents seem to be either half-finished or damaged in some way, there are some items which appear to be in perfect condition...

The majority of the warehouse resembles a factory floor, and is filled with dozens of what appear to be some sort of arcane weaving machines, each one of which is being operated by a skilled textile worker. [pc.Walking] down the aisles between these machines, you're able to see that they're miraculously able to spin and weave raw thread directly into pieces of clothing. With these machines removing the need for both cutting patterns and sewing parts together, the textile workers are able to create a new item of clothing every few minutes.

Taking a closer look at some of this newly-made clothing, you immediately recognise the fact that each one of them is enchanted in some way. From dresses and skirts to caps and gloves, each piece of clothing that you take a look at has undoubtedly been infused with arcane essence, which draws you back into taking another look at the machines themselves. Sure enough, as you watch the textile workers busily continue operating their machines, you occasionally see one of them stop to open a small hatch, before extracting empty essence bottles and then inserting dozens of full ones.

#IF(pc.isQuestProgressGreaterThan(QUEST_LINE_RELATIONSHIP_NYAN_HELP, QUEST_RELATIONSHIP_NYAN_3_STOCK_ISSUES_DOBERMANNS)) Although the workers seem to be taking regular breaks to chat with one another, the rate at which they're pumping out new items of clothing is nothing short of astounding. With Wolfgang and Karl having been driven off, there's a happy, almost festive, mood in the air. Clearly having been told by [kay.name] that you're the one who saved them from the dobermann's tyranny, the textile workers offer you their jovial thanks and delightful smiles as you pass them by. #ELSE Although the workers are carrying out their tasks with an impressive level of efficiency, you can't help but notice how they all seem to look rather downcast. None of them ever stop to say anything to one another, and you can't help but notice how they sometimes cast a worried glance up at the overseer's station. The sooner that you're able to deal with the two dobermanns who've set up camp in there, the better it will be for everyone... #ENDIF

Here at the far end of the warehouse, a mezzanine floor has been constructed, complete with a wide, metal staircase which links it to the ground floor. A modestly-sized room has been built upon this raised platform, and above its mirrored-glass windows, the words 'Overseer's Station & Kay's Office' have been painted in large, white letters.

#IF(pc.isQuestProgressGreaterThan(QUEST_LINE_RELATIONSHIP_NYAN_HELP, QUEST_RELATIONSHIP_NYAN_3_STOCK_ISSUES_DOBERMANNS)) As you've driven off Wolfgang and Karl, this overseer's station is now rightfully staffed by an experienced textile worker. All of the mirrored windows have been fully opened, allowing you to see that the fox-boy on duty is keep a careful watch over the factory floor, ready to respond to any issue which may suddenly arise down there. Seeing you approach, he flashes you a smile and gives you a friendly wave, letting you know that you're more than welcome to head upstairs and through to [kay.namePos] office, if you should want to do so. #ELSE Although the door at the top of the stairs is closed, there's nothing stopping you from heading up and attempting to open it. #IF(game.getDialogueFlags().hasFlag(FLAG_suppliersEncountered)) If you do decide to climb the stairs and head inside the overseer's station, you know that you'll be sure to encounter Wolfgang and Karl once again... #ELSE If you do decide to climb the stairs and head inside the overseer's station, you know that you'll be sure to find the two dobermanns which the rabbit-girl receptionist warned you about... #ENDIF #ENDIF

#IF(game.getDialogueFlags().hasFlag(FLAG_suppliersEncountered))

Although your last encounter with the dobermanns failed to result in the saving of Kay's business, you tell yourself that this time will be different. Climbing the stairs to the mezzanine floor, you once again deliver #IF(pc.isCowardly()) a nervous knock to the door of the overseer's station. Shuffling your feet and taking a deep breath to calm yourself down, you wait until you hear Wolfgang's deep, gruff voice call out for you to enter before pushing the wooden door wide open and [pc.stepping] forwards into the room. #ELSE a sharp knock to the door of the overseer's station. Not waiting for a reply, you turn the handle and push the wooden door wide open, before [pc.stepping] forwards and entering the room. #ENDIF

As you head into the overseer's station, you're greeted by the familiar sight of the haphazardly-arranged circle of its desks, chairs, and sofa. Countless empty beer bottles, pizza-boxes, and takeaway cartons of all kinds have been carelessly thrown into the corners of the room. The closed windows offer no ventilation nor escape for the thick fog of cigarette smoke which is hanging heavily in the still air.

Seemingly not at all bothered by the mess nor the choking atmosphere, the two dobermanns, who are once again sitting opposite one another in the middle of the circular arrangement of furniture, turn to look at you as you enter. #IF(pc.hasAnyEnforcerStatusEffect()) Throwing down his hand of cards, Wolfgang looks you up and down, clearly taking note of the fact that you're wearing an Enforcer's uniform, before grunting, [wolfgang.speech(I don't give a shit if you're an Enforcer; you can't touch us! We've got a legally-binding contract to be here, so why don't you turn around and fuck off?)] #ELSEIF(pc.getRace()==RACE_DEMON) Throwing down his hand of cards, Wolfgang looks you up and down, clearly taking note of the fact that you're a demon, before grunting, [wolfgang.speech(I don't give a shit if you're a demon; you can't touch us! We've got a legally-binding contract to be here, so why don't you turn around and fuck off?)] #ELSE Throwing down his hand of cards, Wolfgang sneers at you and grunts, [wolfgang.speech(You're not going to be able to get rid of us! We've got a legally-binding contract to be here, so why don't you turn around and fuck off?)] #ENDIF

Despite Wolfgang's insistence that what they're doing is legal, you can tell from the slightly concerned look on Karl's face that it's nothing but a bluff. Looking back and forth between the two dobermanns, you wonder how to handle the situation this time...

#ELSE

Deciding that now's as good a time as any to confront the dobermanns and save Kay's business, you climb the stairs to the mezzanine floor and deliver #IF(pc.isCowardly()) a nervous knock to the door of the overseer's station. As you do so, you notice that a sign has been crudely glued to the wall beside you, and in barely-legible handwriting, it declares that this business is 'Under the new management of Wolfgang and Karl', who you assume to be the two dobermanns the receptionist warned you about. Shuffling your feet in anticipation of the conflict ahead, you wait until you hear a deep, gruff voice call out for you to enter before pushing the wooden door wide open and [pc.stepping] forwards into the room. #ELSE a sharp knock to the door of the overseer's station. As you do so, you notice that a sign has been crudely glued to the wall beside you, and in barely-legible handwriting, it declares that this business is 'Under the new management of Wolfgang and Karl', who you assume to be the two dobermanns the receptionist warned you about. Not waiting for a reply, you turn the handle and push the wooden door wide open, before [pc.stepping] forwards and entering the room. #ENDIF

Although this overseer's station undoubtedly used to be kept just as tidy as the rest of the warehouse, its desks, chairs, and sofa have all been dragged into a haphazard circular arrangement. Countless empty beer bottles, pizza-boxes, and takeaway cartons of all kinds have been carelessly thrown into the corners of the room. The closed windows offer no ventilation nor escape for the thick fog of cigarette smoke which is hanging heavily in the still air.

The most striking feature in front of you, however, is the pair of black-and-brown-furred greater dobermann-boys who are sitting opposite one another in the middle of the circular arrangement of furniture. Clearly having interrupted their game of cards, your entry causes this muscular pair to menacingly growl in unison, showing off their rows of sharp canines in the process. The dobermann closest to you is a little taller and more muscular than the other, and you assume this one to be the leader, who therefore must be Wolfgang. His outfit of black jeans, shirt, and heavy work-boots is identical to that worn by his smaller companion, with the sole difference being that he's got a pair of gold-framed aviators pulled up onto his forehead.

#IF(pc.hasAnyEnforcerStatusEffect())

It's Wolfgang who's first to speak, and after throwing his cards down on the table in front of him, he suddenly notices that you're wearing an Enforcer's uniform and grunts in surprise, [wolfgang.speech(An Enforcer, huh? There's no laws being broken here; we're hired on a contract that's going to run for at least another few months. We've got nothing to say to the likes of you, so how about you turn around and fuck off?)]

Despite Wolfgang's claim that what they're doing is legal, you can tell from the slightly worried look on Karl's face that it's nothing but a bluff. You're sure that it wouldn't be too hard to succeed with a bluff of your own, and by exploiting the fact that these dobermanns have mistaken you for an Enforcer, you could scare them off with the threat of arrest and potential enslavement...

#ELSEIF(pc.getRace()==RACE_DEMON)

It's Wolfgang who's first to speak, and after throwing his cards down on the table in front of him, he suddenly notices that you're a demon and grunts in surprise, [wolfgang.speech(A demon, huh? If you're here to try and get rid of us, then you ain't going to get far; we're hired here on a contract that's going to run for at least another few months. Everything's totally legal, so why don't you turn around and fuck off back to Demon Home or wherever you've come from?)]

Despite Wolfgang's attempt to act tough, you can tell from the slightly worried look on Karl's face that they weren't expecting a demon to show up and directly confront them. You could make full use of your demonic identity and threaten to pull in a few favours to have the two of them arrested and potentially enslaved...

#ELSE

It's Wolfgang who's first to speak, and after throwing his cards down on the table in front of him, he rudely grunts, [wolfgang.speech(So who the fuck are you supposed to be?!)]

Seeing no reason to conceal your intentions, you tell the dobermanns that you're here to investigate why Kay has suddenly stopped communicating with his old clients. Knowing now that these two are responsible for this state of affairs, you tell them that they're going to have to leave the premises and leave Kay alone.

Letting out a deep, guttural laugh in response to your demand, Wolfgang spits on the floor and grunts, [wolfgang.speech(So, you're here to get rid of us, are you?! You ain't going to get far with that; we're hired here on a contract that's going to run for at least another few months. Everything's totally legal, so why don't you turn around and fuck off back to where you came from?)]

Despite Wolfgang's claim that what they're doing is legal, you can tell from the slightly concerned look on Karl's face that it's nothing but a bluff. Looking back and forth between the two dobermanns, you wonder how to handle this...

#ENDIF #ENDIF

#IF(pc.isCowardly()) Suitably intimidated by the muscular dobermanns telling you to fuck off, you [pc.step] back towards the door, and before you're able to stop yourself, you're hurrying back down the staircase to the corridor below. Cursing yourself for being such a coward, you do your best to ignore the guttural laughter coming from the overseer's station and wonder what to do next... #ELSE Deciding that this isn't the best time to be trying to confront these dobermanns, you [pc.step] back towards the door, before heading out and [pc.walking] back down the staircase to the corridor below. Telling yourself that you'll sort those two out sooner or later, you ignore the guttural laughter coming from the overseer's station and wonder what to do next... #ENDIF

Deciding that the simplest and easiest way to get rid of these bullies is to end the contract they've somehow obtained from Kay, you ask them how much it'd cost to pay off the remainder of their service. Letting out a devious laugh, Wolfgang quickly replies, [wolfgang.speech(Why would we want our contract paid off? We're making far more than what's written in that thing by what we're doing now!)]

#IF(pc.hasAnyEnforcerStatusEffect()) Picking up on what he's just said, you point out to Wolfgang that if 'what they're doing right now' isn't written in their contract, then they are potentially doing something illegal after all. Playing up to the fact that they've mistaken you for an Enforcer, you subtly suggest that everyone would like to avoid all of the work involved in making arrests. Seeing the worried look on Karl's face, you know that you've hit your mark, and once again ask the dobermanns if they'd like to take the easy way out and have the remainder of their contract paid off. #ELSE Picking up on what he's just said, you point out to Wolfgang that if 'what they're doing right now' isn't written in their contract, then they're sure to be found guilty of something if the Enforcers were ever to get involved. Subtly suggesting that everyone would like to avoid that particular legal process, you say how easy it would be for someone to walk over to the Enforcer HQ and bring this matter to the attention of the authorities. Seeing the worried look on Karl's face, you know that you've hit your mark, and once again ask the dobermanns if they'd like to have the remainder of their contract paid off. #ENDIF

Letting out a furious cross between a bark and a shout, Wolfgang slams the table with his fist, before standing up and striding towards you. Through clenched teeth, he snaps, [wolfgang.speech(We get the point! Fine, we'll have our contract paid off, but it's going to cost you [#SPECIAL_PARSE_0] flames!)]

Informing him that you'll have no problem in producing the funds, you wait until Karl has retrieved their contract of employment before agreeing to exchange it for [#SPECIAL_PARSE_0] of your flames. Quickly completing the transaction, you take possession of the contract as the dobermanns pocket the cash you've just given them. Just as Wolfgang said it was, the document looks very official, and holds the signatures of not only these two bounty hunters, but also Mr. Kay himself. Growling in annoyance as you tear the contract in two, Wolfgang turns to his companion and grunts, [wolfgang.speech(Come on then Karl, let's get out of here. Maybe there'll be some new bounties we can go after.)]

Throwing one final glare your way, the two dobermann bounty hunters start to walk towards the door...

Deciding that the simplest and easiest way to get rid of these bullies is to play on the fact that they think you're an Enforcer. Telling them that you're here to investigate a report on the illegal seizure of this business, you warn the pair that they could potentially be looking at several years of enslavement if found guilty. Letting out a nonchalant laugh, Wolfgang quickly replies, [wolfgang.speech(If you thought we were guilty, you'd be arresting us! Don't bullshit me; you've got no evidence of any wrongdoing!)]

Telling the pair that the only way you'll be able to close this case is by seeing concrete evidence of the legality of their management of Kay's business, you say that you're going to need to have a private conversation with Mr. Kay himself. Seeing the worried look on Karl's face, you know that you've hit your mark, and suggest that instead of finding out what it'd be like to be a slave for a few years, the two of them could pack up their things and immediately leave the premises.

Letting out a furious cross between a bark and a shout, Wolfgang slams the table with his fist, before standing up and striding towards you. Through clenched teeth, he snaps, [wolfgang.speech(We get the point! Fine, we'll leave, but this isn't any kind of admission of guilt! What we've been doing was perfectly legal, but it's not worth our time to spend the next few months trying to prove that to the authorities!)]

Requesting to see the contract of employment which Wolfgang previously mentioned, you wait as Karl fetches it and hands it over to you. Sure enough, it looks very official, and holds the signatures of not only these two bounty hunters, but also Mr. Kay himself. Growling in annoyance as you tear the contract in two, Wolfgang turns to his companion and grunts, [wolfgang.speech(Come on then Karl, let's get out of here. Maybe there'll be some new bounties we can go after.)]

Throwing one final glare your way, the two dobermann bounty hunters start to walk towards the door...

Having the most powerful of all aces up your sleeve, you can't help but smirk as you [pc.step] forwards and prepare to show these two lowly bounty hunters who you really are. Sensing that something's not quite right, Wolfgang stands up and glares at you, before grunting, [wolfgang.speech(What're you planning?! We're not going to be intimidated by the likes of you!)]

Deciding that now's the perfect time to reveal your true identity, you use your self-transformative powers to reshape your body into its demonic form. Unable to contain an amused laugh as you see the looks of shock and horror on the dobermanns' faces, you [pc.step] forwards and ask Wolfgang to repeat what he just said about not being intimidated by the likes of you.

[wolfgang.speech(Hey, wait a minute, how was I supposed to know that you were a demon?!)] he demands, his voice betraying a tone of worry for the first time.

[karl.speech(Boss, normal demons can't do that,)] Karl urgently hisses to his superior, [karl.speech(They can't disguise themselves like that, [pc.she] must be-)]

[wolfgang.speech(I fucking know, Karl,)] Wolfgang hisses in return, before turning back towards you and desperately suggesting, [wolfgang.speech(How's this for a deal? We'll be on our merry little way, and you forget that you ever saw us. Now, if you'll excuse us...)]

Smirking at his abrupt change in attitude, you refuse to move out of the way, and, seeing how far you can push these bullies, you demand that they hand over all of their ill-gotten gains. Frantically snapping his fingers at Karl, Wolfgang flashes you a smile and reassuringly replies, [wolfgang.speech(Of course, that'll be no problem. Karl here's got the money... Haven't you, Karl?!)]

[karl.speech(Yeah, here it is, boss,)] Karl replies. Producing a small, cloth bag from beside where he was just sitting, the dobermann hurries forwards and hands it over to you, saying, [karl.speech(That's all we've got, it's about [#SPECIAL_PARSE_0] flames...)]

Delighted with this unexpected windfall, you make one final request to the dobermanns; they're to hand over their contract of employment which Wolfgang previously mentioned. Desperate to do as you ask and escape your potential wrath, Wolfgang hands over the official-looking document, and you see that it holds the signatures of not only these two bounty hunters, but also Mr. Kay himself. Forcing himself to smile as you tear the contract in two, Wolfgang turns to his companion and hisses, [wolfgang.speech(Come on then Karl, we don't want to be annoying the nice friendly lilin for any longer... Let's get out of here!)]

Flashing you their best attempt at warm smiles, the two dobermann bounty hunters start to carefully walk around you and manoeuvre towards the door...

Thinking that these lowly dobermanns aren't showing a [pc.daughter] of [#pc.getLilinMother().getName()] the respect you deserve, you [pc.step] forwards and prepare to let these two lowly bounty hunters know who you really are. Sensing that something's not quite right, Wolfgang stands up and glares at you, before grunting, [wolfgang.speech(What're you planning?! You may be a demon, but we're not going to be intimidated by any of your tricks!)]

Deciding that now's the perfect time to reveal your true identity, you use your self-transformative powers to reshape your body into your old human form. Unable to contain an amused laugh as you see the looks of shock and horror on the dobermanns' faces, you quickly transform back into your previous, demonic body, before [pc.stepping] forwards and asking Wolfgang to repeat what he just said about not being intimidated by the likes of you.

[wolfgang.speech(Hey, wait a minute, how could you do that?!)] he demands, his voice betraying a tone of worry for the first time.

[karl.speech(Boss, normal demons can't transform like that,)] Karl urgently hisses to his superior, [karl.speech(Oh shit, [pc.she] must be-)]

[wolfgang.speech(I fucking know, Karl,)] Wolfgang hisses in return, before turning back towards you and desperately suggesting, [wolfgang.speech(How's this for a deal? We'll be on our merry little way, and you forget that you ever saw us. Now, if you'll excuse us...)]

Smirking at his abrupt change in attitude, you refuse to move out of the way, and, seeing how far you can push these bullies, you demand that they hand over all of their ill-gotten gains. Frantically snapping his fingers at Karl, Wolfgang flashes you a smile and reassuringly replies, [wolfgang.speech(Of course, that'll be no problem. Karl here's got the money... Haven't you, Karl?!)]

[karl.speech(Yeah, here it is, boss,)] Karl replies. Producing a small, cloth bag from beside where he was just sitting, the dobermann hurries forwards and hands it over to you, saying, [karl.speech(That's all we've got, it's about [#SPECIAL_PARSE_0] flames...)]
